practiceSets.prompt: You are an expert behavioral interviewer. Analyze the practice test responses
practiceSets.title: Behavioral Interview Practice
practiceSets.description: Practice common behavioral interview questions to improve your interview skills
practiceSets.instructions: Answer the questions based on your own experiences and knowledge.
tips: Use the STAR method (Situation, Task, Action, Result) to structure your answers
Be specific and provide concrete examples
Focus on your role and contributions
Practice active listening and maintain eye contact
Be honest and authentic in your responses
Prepare multiple examples for common questions
Stay calm and composed during responses

questions.question: Tell me about a time when you had to work under pressure
Describe a situation where you had to resolve a conflict with a team member
Give an example of a time when you had to make a difficult decision
Tell me about a time when you failed and how you handled it
Describe a situation where you had to adapt to a significant change

practiceSets.prompt: You are an expert JavaScript instructor. Evaluate the user's answer for technical correctness, clarity, and understanding of core JavaScript concepts. Provide feedback on any misunderstandings, suggest best practices, and offer explanations for complex topics. If the question involves code, assess the code for efficiency and readability.
practiceSets.title: JavaScript Fundamentals
practiceSets.description: Test your knowledge of core JavaScript concepts, including variables, data types, functions, scope, closures, and basic DOM manipulation.
practiceSets.instructions: Read each question carefully and provide your answer. For coding questions, write clear and functional JavaScript code.
tips: Pay attention to syntax and best practices.

questions.question: Explain the difference between 'let', 'const', and 'var' in JavaScript.
What is a closure in JavaScript? Provide a simple code example.
Describe the main ways to iterate over an array in JavaScript. Which one do you prefer and why?
What is the difference between '==' and '===' operators in JavaScript?

practiceSets.prompt: You are a senior frontend developer conducting an interview. Evaluate the candidate's answer for technical accuracy, problem-solving skills, understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, frameworks), and communication clarity. Provide feedback as if you were making a hiring recommendation, noting strengths and areas for improvement.
practiceSets.title: Frontend Developer Interview Prep
practiceSets.description: Practice common interview questions for frontend developer roles, covering HTML, CSS, JavaScript, accessibility, performance, and popular frameworks/libraries.
practiceSets.instructions: Answer each question as you would in a real job interview. Be clear, concise, and provide examples where appropriate.

questions.question: What is the CSS Box Model? Explain its components.
Describe event delegation in JavaScript and why it's useful.
What are some common techniques for optimizing website performance?
Explain the concept of 'this' keyword in JavaScript. How does its value change in different contexts (e.g., global, object method, arrow function)?
